Rationale / Strategic Philosophy: A classic "more is better" survival metric. At this stage, there is no such thing as too much runway. The goal is to maximize viability. A Target_Ideal of 12 months represents a full year of stability, the gold standard for an early-stage venture.
Increased Sensitivity KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas
Actionable KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas

Rationale / Strategic Philosophy: A straightforward project completion metric. The sole purpose of this KPI is to reach 100%, formalizing the core IP of the venture.
Increased Sensitivity KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas
Actionable KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas

Rationale / Strategic Philosophy: This is the archetypal "Plateau of Coherence." The goal is not maximum energy (mania), but a sustainable, creative flow. The 7-8.5 range is defined as the healthy, resonant state of being.
Another project completion metric. The goal is the full establishment of the foundational governance "spine."
Increased Sensitivity KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas
Actionable KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas

Rationale / Strategic Philosophy: A measure of communicative resonance. A score of 4.5 out of 5 represents a profound level of clarity and connection with the audience. The minimum acceptable score is 2; anything less is a failure to communicate.
Increased Sensitivity KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas
Actionable KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas

Rationale / Strategic Philosophy: A crucial "quality over quantity" metric. The goal is not endless networking, but a focused, rhythmic engagement with key potential partners. Fewer than 2 conversations/month is stagnation; more than 4 is a distraction; more than 8 is "networking theater."

A simple, top-of-funnel activity metric for the early stage. The goal is to establish a consistent, rhythmic voice for the project. 2 high-quality, vision-aligned posts per week is the ideal target for now.
Increased Sensitivity KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas
Actionable KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas

Rationale / Strategic Philosophy: A binary, milestone-based metric. It is either done or not done. The goal is to reach the state of "1" (complete).
This measures the habit of integrity. The goal is to consciously consider 100% of key operational decisions through a regenerative lens. It is about the process, not (yet) the quantitative outcome.
Increased Sensitivity KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas
Actionable KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas

Rationale / Strategic Philosophy: Identical in logic to the Regenerative Choices KPI. This measures the habit of consciously aligning every key strategic decision with the venture's core values.
Increased Sensitivity KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas
Actionable KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas

Rationale / Strategic Philosophy: Another critical "quality over quantity" metric. The goal is not to "spray and pray" applications, but to pursue a focused number of high-quality, deeply aligned funding opportunities. 1-4 per month is a healthy, sustainable rhythm of high-quality effort.
Increased Sensitivity KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas
Actionable KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas

Rationale / Strategic Philosophy: The first and most important step in building systemic resilience. The immediate goal is to move the system from a fragile state of 1 to a more robust state of 2.
Increased Sensitivity KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas
Actionable KPI Target: Pause & Rebalance. Focus on Positive Deltas

KPI_ID: This worksheet serves as an initial input for the Siral-Dashboard, followed through the IFC thought framework: PESTEL&Peters5Forces, McKinsey 7S Framework, SWOT&Controntation, Attack-Defend-Withdraw-Maneuvire, Strategy Map(KSIs), Balanced-Scorecard, =  KPIS.
During the application of the model, the 12 initial KPIs later became a face of the dodecahedron each, dissected through the 5 elemental KPIs in the REFERENCE_MODELS sheet.

KPI_Name: =IF(AND(Value >= Healthy_Min, Value <= Healthy_Max), 1, IF(Value < Healthy_Min, (Value - Target_Min) / (Healthy_Min - Target_Min), 1 - (Value - Healthy_Max) / (Absolute_Max - Healthy_Max)))

KPI_ID: This formula remains the same, as it is simple and robust.
Example (% Thesis Drafted): With Value=50, Min=0, Ideal=100, the score is (50-0)/(100-0) = 0.5. Perfect.
This is the inverse of the "Up is Better" formula.
Required Columns: Value, Target_Min (this now represents the "dangerously high" number), Target_Ideal (this represents the perfect "low" score).
Target_Ideal = 1 (The goal is 1 error or less)
Interpretation: A score of 0.78 makes sense. You are not at the ideal, but you are much closer to the ideal (1) than to the catastrophe point (10).
3. The Band (Plateau) Formula - The Final, Corrected Version
Required Columns: Value, Target_Min, Healthy_Min, Healthy_Max, Absolute_Max.

=IF(AND(VALUE >= Healthy_Min, VALUE <= Healthy_Max), 1, IF(VALUE < Healthy_Min, MAX(0, (VALUE - Target_Min) / (Healthy_Min - Target_Min)), MAX(0, 1 - (VALUE - Healthy_Max) / (Absolute_Max - Healthy_Max))))
